creator: lag@3ds.com
text:
Our server is receiving many Application Errors (reported in the Event Viewer): Faulting application httpd.exe, version 2.2.3.0, faulting module php5ts.dll, version 5.2.0.0, fault address 0x00009e2f.
These application errors started to appear over one year ago when we migrated :
Apache 1.3.7 to 2.2.3
PHP 4.3.10 to 5.2
MySQL 4.0.15 to 4.1
But initially this error occurred maybe once a week and it did not seem to have an effect on the server.   Now this error occurs at least twice an hour and the server eventually hangs.  The problem will temporarily go away for about 17 hours if the Apache service is stopped and restarted.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
"faulting module php5ts.dll, version 5.2.0.0"

so this is a fault in PHP which is not an Apache project, please confer
with the folks at php.net, and you might find a user list first.

Note Apache is at 2.2.9 and PHP 5 at 5.2.6, so before you even log any
report, you might check if those versions clear up your issue.
